title.rendered: Party Dance Video of MS Dhoni and Hardik hitting the Internet

content.rendered:
Since the time he started creating headlines, MS Dhoni has been a relaxed, cool temperament for his fans. He doesn’t appreciate nightlife or parties. Even throughout the first days of the Indian Premier League once the parties were a standard affair, Dhoni was never seen in those late-night parties. However, he has currently retired from international cricket and plays solely the IPL. He was seen having fun at a celebration in port with T20 captain Hardik Pandya and Sakshi Singh Dhoni, his wife. Dhoni, during a video from a constant party, is often seen singing with rapper Badshah, even shaking a leg on his songs.

MSD not only partied with Badshah; he even became a DJ for a short time.

These videos were shared on the Instagram handle of his spouse Sakshi.

While Dhoni is free lately as he’s retired and provides additional attention to varied businesses he has started, Hardik has joined him from New Zealand. He was recently in New Zealand to steer India within the T20Is. He won the series 1-0 and contributed vastly with each bat and ball.

“Our jam, our moves. What a night!” check the video caption shared on Instagram. The video opens with Hardik Pandya and MS Dhoni performing to R… Rajkumar’s Gandi Baat. As the video progresses, Krunal Pandya and all joined as part of them on the floor to groove to ‘Dilliwali Girlfriend ‘from the film Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani.

At the top of this, Badshah joins the cricketers and sings his song Paagal. The video was shared some minutes a gone, and it’s since accumulated over 8.6 Lakh views, therefore the number of area units quickly increased. The share has conjointly received several comments.

“Mad scenes”, commented a private. “Seeing MSD performing arts like this! One could be a generation moment. virtually hilarious” denote another. “Best of best, MS King,” shared a 3rd.

The comments section is replete with heart and heart emoticons.

Read Also: PT USHA will be the first Woman President of the IOA
